title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, amending Section 4121 of title 5, United States Code to define the term 'supervisor' and establish operating standards for consultation. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, establishing operating standards for consultation and interactive instructor-based training on actions and strategies for supervisors. Supervisors receive training on developing goals, mentoring employees, managing performance, and fulfilling their duties. The program includes training for supervisors on improving employee performance, managing unacceptable performance, and fulfilling their duties. Additionally, there is interactive instructor-based training on prohibited personnel practices and procedures for enforcing employee rights, as well as a mentoring program for experienced supervisors. Not later than 1 year after appointment, supervisors participate in a mentoring program where experienced supervisors transfer knowledge in communication, critical thinking, motivating employees, and teamwork. After appointment, supervisors must complete programs focusing on communication, critical thinking, motivating employees, and teamwork. They are required to participate in mentoring and development programs at least once every three years. Credit is given for prior experience. Supervisors must complete training programs every three years, with credit given for prior training. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment to monitor agency compliance with the new section. The amendments made by this section will take effect 180 days after the date of enactment and apply to individuals appointed to supervisor positions. The amendments made by this section will take effect 180 days after the date of enactment of the Act and apply to individuals appointed to supervisor positions on or after that effective date. Each individual employed as a supervisor on the effective date of this section will be required to comply with the new regulations. Each supervisor employed on the effective date of this section must complete specified programs within 3 years and then every 3 years thereafter. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. The text chunk discusses the amendment of Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code, to include new management competency standards for supervisors defined under section 7103(a)(10) and (11). The Office of Personnel Management will issue guidance on the standards supervisors are expected to meet. The Office of Personnel Management will issue guidance on standards for supervisors to effectively manage employee performance. Each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors based on the guidance provided. The agency must consider guidance from the Office of Personnel Management when developing standards for supervisors. They should assess supervisors' capacity to meet the guidance and implement a training program to address any identified issues. Additionally, agencies must submit a report to the Office of Personnel Management annually or as requested. The agency must develop a supervisor training program to address identified issues and submit progress reports annually to the Office of Personnel Management. Technical amendments are also made to the table of sections for chapter 43 of title 5. Section 4305 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to reference section 4306.
